<A NAME="eolPage97"></A>
<BR CLEAR="ALL" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS;">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
<A HREF="#A16-6109_120F_HTM_TABLEOFCONTENTS" TITLE="CLICK TO GO TO TABLE OF CONTENTS">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	ATA INC.
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Notes to the Consolidated Financial Statements (Continued)
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Through the VIE Agreements, the Company had a controlling financial interest in ATA Online because the Company had (i)&nbsp;the power to direct activities of ATA Online that most significantly impact the economic performance of ATA Online ( refer to the &#147;Power of attorney agreement&#148;); and (ii)&nbsp;the obligation to absorb the expected losses and the right to receive expected residual return of ATA Online that could potentially be significant to ATA Online(refer to the &#147;Call option and cooperation agreement&#148;).
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	The termination of the VIE Agreements and the transfer of equity interests of ATA Online from the nominee shareholders to the Group had no impact on the Group&#146;s controlling financial interest in ATA Online. Accordingly, the financial statements of ATA Online are consolidated in the Company&#146;s consolidated financial statements for the years ended March&nbsp;31, 201
</FONT>
	4, 2015 and 2016. All of the equity (net assets) and net incomes or losses of ATA Online are attributed to the Company; therefore, no non-controlling interest in ATA Online is presented in the Company&#146;s consolidated financial statements.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	The key terms of these VIE Agreements are as follows:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<B>
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Loan agreements:
</FONT>
</I>
</B>
	ATA BVI lent to ATA Online&#146;s equity holders, Mr.&nbsp;Kevin Xiaofeng Ma, and Mr.&nbsp;Walter Lin Wang, interest free loans in the amount of RMB10 million for the sole purpose of investing in ATA Online as ATA Online&#146;s registered capital. The equity holders of ATA Online can only repay the loans by transferring all of their legal ownership interest in ATA Online to ATA BVI or to a third party designated by ATA BVI. The equity holders of ATA Online are required to pay to ATA BVI all dividend received from ATA Online.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:2.25PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Upon termination of the VIE Agreement in May&nbsp;2015, the nominee shareholders received RMB10 million from the transfer of the legal ownership interests in ATA Online to ATA Learning and Zhongxiao Zhixing in November&nbsp;2015. Such proceeds will be repaid to ATA BVI based on the agreement with the nominee shareholders.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<B>
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Technical support agreement:
</FONT>
</I>
</B>
	ATA Learning has the exclusive right to provide technical support services to ATA Online. The service fees are mutually agreed by both parties, and are determined based on certain objective criteria such as the actual services required by ATA Online and the actual labor costs, as determined by the number of days and personnel involved, incurred by ATA Learning for providing the services during the relevant period.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<B>
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Strategic consulting service agreement:
</FONT>
</I>
</B>
	ATA Learning provides ATA Online with strategic consulting and related services to ATA Online. The fees for these services are determined by ATA Learning and calculated monthly based on actual time spent providing the services. ATA Learning has the right to adjust the fees payable by ATA Online in accordance with its performance.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	For the years ended March&nbsp;31, 2014, 2015 and 2016, ATA Learning billed RMB 8.0 million, RMB 18.0 million and RMB nil to ATA Online based on the technical support agreement and strategic consulting service agreement.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<B>
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Call option and cooperation agreement:
</FONT>
</I>
</B>
	Through the call option and cooperation agreement entered into among ATA BVI, ATA Online and its equity holders, ATA BVI or any party designated by ATA BVI, has an exclusive purchase option to acquire the equity interest in ATA Online from its equity holders or acquire ATA Online&#146;s assets at any time when permitted by applicable Chinese laws and regulations. The proceeds from the exercise of the call option will be applied to repay the loans under the loan agreements described above.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	F-
</FONT>
	20
<A NAME="A16-6109_120F_HTM_PB_20_210707_455">
</A>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<HR SIZE="3" WIDTH="100%" NOSHADE ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="COLOR:#010101;">
</DIV>
</DIV>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='F-20',FILE='C:\JMS\107899\16-6109-1\TASK7998367\6109-1-FP.HTM',USER='107899',CD='JUN 22 21:07 2016' -->
<A NAME="eolPage98"></A>
<BR CLEAR="ALL" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS;">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
<A HREF="#A16-6109_120F_HTM_TABLEOFCONTENTS" TITLE="CLICK TO GO TO TABLE OF CONTENTS">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	ATA INC.
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Notes to the Consolidated Financial Statements (Continued)
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<B>
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Equity pledge agreement:
</FONT>
</I>
</B>
	To secure the payment obligations of ATA Online under the technical support agreement and the strategic consulting service agreement described above, ATA Online&#146;s equity holders have pledged to ATA Learning their entire equity ownership interests in ATA Online. Under this agreement, equity holders of ATA Online may not transfer the pledged equity interest without ATA Learning&#146;s prior written consent. .
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<B>
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Power of attorney:
</FONT>
</I>
</B>
	Each of Mr.&nbsp;Kevin Xiaofeng Ma and Mr.&nbsp;Walter Lin Wang signed a power of attorney, on March&nbsp;27, 2013 and April&nbsp;3, 2013 respectively, with ATA Learning to exclusively assign their rights as an shareholder of ATA Online to ATA Learning, including but not limited to voting right and right to appoint director and executive management of ATA Online. The assignment of the shareholder&#146;s rights is legally binding, irrevocable.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	The VIE Agreements were terminated in May&nbsp;2015. The Company&#146;s involvement with the VIE under the VIE Agreements affected the Company&#146;s consolidated financial position as of March&nbsp;31, 2015, and results of operations and cash flows for the years ended March&nbsp;31, 2014 and 2015 as indicated below.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">

<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Amounts due
</FONT>
	from related parties represent the amount due from ATA BVI, ATA Learning and ATA Testing, which are eliminated in consolidation.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Amounts due to related parties represent the amount due to ATA BVI
</FONT>
	, ATA Learning and ATA Testing, which are eliminated in consolidation.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	All of the assets of ATA Online can be used only to settle obligations of ATA Online. None of the assets of ATA Online has been pledged or collateralized. The creditors of ATA Online do not have recourse to the general credit of ATA BVI or the Company.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<B>
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	(
</FONT>
</I>
</B>
<B>
<I STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	w
</I>
</B>
<B>
<I STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	)
</I>
</B>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<B>
<I STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Recently issued accounting standards
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .25IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	In November&nbsp;2015, the FASB issued ASU No.&nbsp;2015-17,&nbsp;I
</FONT>
<I>
	ncome Taxes - Balance Sheet Classification of Deferred Taxes
</I>
	. The ASU requires entities with a classified balance sheet to present all deferred tax assets and liabilities as noncurrent. The ASU is effective for annual reporting periods in fiscal years beginning after December&nbsp;15, 2016. Early adoption is permitted at the beginning of an annual period and requires either a prospective or retrospective approach to adoption. The Group is currently evaluating the impact ASU 2015-17 will have on its consolidated financial statements.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .25IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	In February&nbsp;2016, the FASB issued Accounting Standards Codification (&#147;ASC&#148;) Topic 842,
</FONT>
<I>
	Leases
</I>
	through ASU No.&nbsp;2016-02. ASC Topic 842 requires a lessee to recognize all leases, including operating leases, on balance sheet via a right-of-use asset and lease liability, unless the lease is a short-term lease. All (or a portion of) fixed payments by the lessee to cover lessor costs related to ownership of the underlying assets, or executory costs, that do not represent payments for a good or service will be considered lease payments and reflected in the measurement of lease assets and lease liabilities by lessees. The new standard does not substantially change lessor accounting from current U.S. GAAP. The new standard also requires lessees and lessors to disclose more qualitative and quantitative information about their leases than current U.S. GAAP does. The standard is applied retrospectively, with elective reliefs. The new standard is effective for annual and interim reporting periods beginning after December&nbsp;15, 2018 for a public business entity. Early adoption is permitted. The Group is currently evaluating the impact ASU 2016-02 will have on its consolidated financial statements.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .25IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	In March&nbsp;2016, the FASB issued ASU 2016-09, Compensation - Stock Compensation (Topic 718). The ASU simplifies certain aspects related to income taxes, statement of cash flows, and forfeitures when accounting for share-based payment transactions. The ASU will be effective for the annual reporting periods beginning after December&nbsp;15, 2016, with earlier adoption permitted. Certain of the amendments related to timing of the recognition of tax benefits and tax withholding requirements should be applied using a modified retrospective transition method. Amendments related to the presentation of the statement of cash flows should be applied retrospectively. The Group is currently evaluating the impact ASU 2016-09 will have on its consolidated financial statements.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	F-
</FONT>
	22
<A NAME="A16-6109_120F_HTM_PB_22_210707_8627">
</A>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<HR SIZE="3" WIDTH="100%" NOSHADE ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="COLOR:#010101;">

	Management performs ongoing credit evaluations of its customers&#146; financial condition and generally does not require collateral on accounts receivable.

<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="BOTTOM" BGCOLOR="#CCEEFF" STYLE="BACKGROUND:#CCEEFF;PADDING:0IN 0IN 0IN 0IN;WIDTH:1.0%;">

<A NAME="eolPage101"></A>
<BR CLEAR="ALL" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS;">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
<A HREF="#A16-6109_120F_HTM_TABLEOFCONTENTS" TITLE="CLICK TO GO TO TABLE OF CONTENTS">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	ATA INC.
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Notes to the Consolidated Financial Statements (Continued)
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .25IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	In
</FONT>
	August&nbsp;2014, ATA Online made a 45% equity interest investment to establish Beijing Zhishang Education Technology Ltd. (&#147;Zhishang&#148;), an online professional training provider based in the PRC, by paying cash of RMB 13,500,000. The other shareholder of Zhishang is New Oriental Education&nbsp;&amp; Technology Group. ATA online accounted for the investment under the equity method. ATA online recognized its share of loss from this equity investment of RMB 1,103,275 and RMB 4,694,972 for the year ended March&nbsp;31, 2015 and 2016, respectively.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .25IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	In December&nbsp;2014, ATA Online made a 33% equity interest investment in Master Mind Education Company (&#147;Master Mind&#148;), a digital service provider for K-12 after-school tutoring institute based in the PRC, by paying cash of RMB
</FONT>
	18,453,864 in December&nbsp;2014, and RMB 12,302,000 in June&nbsp;2015. Pursuant to the investment agreement, should Master Mind&#146;s 1) net revenue in the year ending March&nbsp;31, 2017 is less than or equal to RMB 157,000,000, 236,000,000 and 315,000,000, and 2) valuation by the new investor by March&nbsp;31, 2017 is below USD 25,000,000, the Company&#146;s equity interest in Master Mind will increase by 18%, 12% and 6% respectively without consideration by way of other shareholders&#146; contribution to the Company ratably. The Company accounted for its 33% equity interest in Master Mind under the equity method and will recognize any additional equity interest when it is realized. The Company recognized its share of loss from this equity investment of RMB 882,809 and RMB 2,314,074 for the year ended March&nbsp;31, 2015 and 2016, respectively.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .25IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	In
</FONT>
	January&nbsp;2015, ATA Online made a 20% equity interest investment in Beijing Satech Internet Educational Technology Ltd. (&#147;Satech&#148;), an online SAT learning platform provider based in the PRC, by paying cash of RMB 6,000,000. Pursuant to the investment agreement with Satech, should Satech&#146;s 1) net revenue in the year ending March&nbsp;31, 2017 is less than or equal to RMB 55,000,000, and 2) valuation by the new investor by March&nbsp;31, 2017 is below RMB 60,000,000, the Company&#146;s equity interest in Satech will increase by 31% without consideration by the way of other shareholders&#146; contribution to the Company ratably . The Company accounted for its 20% equity interest in Satech under the equity method and will recognize any additional equity interest when it is realized. The Company recognized its share of loss from this equity investment of RMB 210,666 and RMB 1,269,187 for the year ended March&nbsp;31, 2015 and 2016, respectively.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .25IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	In
</FONT>
	September&nbsp;2015, ATA BVI entered into an agreement to purchase 2,156,721 Series&nbsp;AA Preferred Shares issued by Brilent Inc. (&#147;Brilent&#148;) at a price of $0.6955 per Series&nbsp;AA Preferred Shares with a total consideration of USD1.5 million. Brilent is a service provider with an easy to use SaaS (Software as a Service) based in the United State. ATA BVI held 15.47% equity interest of Brilent and one board seat out of six as of March&nbsp;31, 2016. The investment is accounted for under the equity method as ATA BVI is able to exercise significant influence through its board seat. The Company recognized its share of loss from this equity investment of RMB 550,907 for the year ended March&nbsp;31, 2016.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .25IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	The summarized financial information of the equity method investments were as follows:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>

<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;

<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	ATA INC.
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Notes to the Consolidated Financial Statements (Continued)
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .25IN;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Available-for-sale investmen
</FONT>
</B>
<B>
	t
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .25IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	On March&nbsp;24, 2016, ATA BVI entered into a convertible promissory notes (&#147;the Notes&#148;) purchase agreement with Brilent pursuant to which Brilent will issue up to USD2,500,000 of the Notes to certain investors including ATA BVI. On March&nbsp;30, 2016, Brilent issued the Notes to ATA BVI in the principal amount of USD300,000
</FONT>
	(RMB1,938,360) at a 6% interest rate per annum, in exchange of cash of USD300,000. The Notes is due and payable 24 months from issuance. If a qualified financing occurs on or prior to the maturity date of the Notes, the Notes and all accrued and unpaid interest on the Notes shall convert, at ATA BVI&#146;s option, into the qualified financing securities at the 75% of the qualified financing security purchase price subject to certain adjustment. The Company determined the fair value of the Notes as of March&nbsp;31, 2016 is USD300,000 (RMB1,938,360).
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>

	(i)&nbsp;
</FONT>
	Contracts in progress of RMB 569,087 and RMB 346,140 recognized at the acquisition date was deducted from the billing upon completion of certain contracts as of March&nbsp;31, 2014 and 2015. The Company recognized an impairment charge of RMB 310,153 upon the cancellation of certain contracts during the year ended March&nbsp;31, 2015.
</P>

</FONT>
	recognized as cost of revenues were RMB 2,359,475, RMB 192,873 and RMB 192,874 for the years ended March&nbsp;31, 2014, 2015 and 2016, respectively.

<TR>

	Other revenue primarily includes licensing fees from authorized test centers, test development services,
</FONT>
	test certificate services, test administration software product sales and operating lease income. The net revenues from product sales are RMB 569,579, RMB 1,252,673 and RMB 490,152 for the years ended March&nbsp;31, 2014, 2015 and 2016, respectively.

<A NAME="eolPage105"></A>
<BR CLEAR="ALL" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS;">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
<A HREF="#A16-6109_120F_HTM_TABLEOFCONTENTS" TITLE="CLICK TO GO TO TABLE OF CONTENTS">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	ATA INC.
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Notes to the Consolidated Financial Statements (Continued)
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:2.25PT;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	(1
</FONT>
</B>
<B>
	1
</B>
<B>
	)
</B>
	&#160;
<B>
	INCOME TAXES
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .25IN;">
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Cayman Islands and British Virgin Islands
</FONT>
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .25IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Under the current laws of the Cayman Islands and the British Virgin Islands, the Group is not subject to any income tax in these jurisdictions.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .25IN;">
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Hong Kong
</FONT>
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .25IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Xing Wei did not derive any income that is subject to Hong Kong profits tax for the taxable year ended March&nbsp;31, 2016. Accordingly, no provision for Hong Kong profit tax was required. The payment of dividends by Hong Kong companies is not subject to any Hong Kong withholding tax.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .25IN;">
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	People&#146;s Republic of China
</FONT>
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .25IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	The Company&#146;s consolidated PRC entities file separate income tax returns.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .25IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	On March&nbsp;16, 2007, the National People&#146;s Congress passed the Enterprise Income Tax Law (&#147;EIT Law&#148;) which statutory income tax rate is 25% effective from January&nbsp;1, 2008. According to the EIT Law, entities that qualify as &#147;high-and-new technology enterprises eligible for key support from the State&#148; (&#147;HNTE&#148;) are entitled to a preferential income tax rate of 15%.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .25IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	The Company&#146;s PRC entities are subject to income tax at 25%, unless otherwise specified.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .25IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	In December&nbsp;2008, ATA Testing received approval from the tax authority that it qualified as an HNTE. The certificate entitled ATA Testing to the preferential income tax rate of 15% effective retroactively from January&nbsp;1, 2008 to December&nbsp;31, 2010. In
</FONT>
	October&nbsp;2011, ATA Testing received approval from the tax authority on its renewal as an HNTE which entitled it to the preferential income tax rate of 15% effective retroactively from January&nbsp;1, 2011 to December&nbsp;31, 2013. In October&nbsp;2014, ATA Testing received approval from the tax authority on its renewal as an HNTE which entitled it to the preferential income tax rate of 15% effective retroactively from January&nbsp;1, 2014 to December&nbsp;31, 2016. ATA Testing&#146;s applicable income tax rate from January&nbsp;1, 2017 onwards will be 25% unless it can re-qualify as HNTE.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .25IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	In December&nbsp;2009, ATA Learning, ATA Online and Beijing JDX received approvals from the tax authorities that they qualified as HNTEs. The certificates entitled them to the preferential income tax rate of 15% effectively retroactively from January&nbsp;1, 2009 to December&nbsp;31, 2011. In
</FONT>
	May&nbsp;and July&nbsp;2012, ATA Learning, ATA Online and Beijing JDX received approvals from the tax authorities on its renewals as HNTEs which entitled them to the preferential income tax rate of 15% effective retroactively from January&nbsp;1, 2012 to December&nbsp;31, 2014. In November&nbsp;2015, ATA Learning, ATA Online and Beijing JDX received approvals from the tax authorities on its renewals as HNTEs which entitled them to the preferential income tax rate of 15% effective retroactively from January&nbsp;1, 2015 to December&nbsp;31, 2017. ATA Learning, ATA Online and Beijing JDX applicable income tax rate from January&nbsp;1, 2018 onward will be 25% unless they can re-qualify as HNTE.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .25IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Zhongxiao Zhixing
</FONT>
	, a PRC subsidiary of Xing Wei, is subject to an income tax rate of 25%.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .25IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	The EIT Law and its relevant regulations impose a withholding tax at 10%, unless reduced by a tax treaty or agreement, for dividends distributed by a PRC-resident enterprise to its immediate holding company outside the PRC for earnings generated beginning on January&nbsp;1, 2008. Undistributed earnings generated prior to January&nbsp;1, 2008 are exempt from withholding tax.
</FONT>
	As of March&nbsp;31, 2016, the Company has not provided for income taxes on earnings of RMB 178,562,047 generated by its PRC consolidated entities since January&nbsp;1, 2008 as the Company plans to reinvest these earnings indefinitely in the PRC. The unrecognized deferred income tax liability related to these earnings was RMB 17,856,205.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	F-
</FONT>
	28
<A NAME="A16-6109_120F_HTM_PB_28_210822_5926">
</A>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<HR SIZE="3" WIDTH="100%" NOSHADE ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="COLOR:#010101;">
</DIV>

<A NAME="eolPage106"></A>
<BR CLEAR="ALL" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS;">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;">

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;

<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .25IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	The actual income tax expense reported in the consolidated statements of
</FONT>
	comprehensive income differs from the respective amount computed by applying the PRC statutory income tax rate of 25% for each of the years ended March&nbsp;31, 2014, 2015 and 2016 to earnings before income taxes due to the following:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_45"></A>
<TABLE BORDER="0" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE;">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="49%" VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="PADDING:0IN 0IN 0IN 0IN;WIDTH:49.5%;">

	The applicable PRC statutory tax rate is used since the Group&#146;s taxable income is generated in the PRC.

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .25IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	As of March&nbsp;31, 201
</FONT>
	6, the valuation allowance of RMB 20,028,588 was related to the deferred income tax assets of PRC entities which were in loss position. As of March&nbsp;31, 2016, management believes it is more likely than not that the Group will realize the deferred income tax assets, net of the valuation allowance. The amount of the deferred income tax assets, however, considered realizable as of March&nbsp;31, 2016 could be reduced in the near term if estimates of future taxable income are reduced.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .25IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	As of March&nbsp;31, 201
</FONT>
	6, the Group had tax loss carry forwards for PRC income tax purpose of RMB 88,264,251, of which RMB nil, RMB nil, RMB 4,996,057, RMB 5,438,101, RMB 41,987,572 and RMB 35,842,521 will expire if unused by December&nbsp;31, 2016, 2017, 2018, 2019, 2020 and 2021, respectively.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .25IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	For the years ended March&nbsp;31, 20
</FONT>
	14, 2015 and 2016, the Group had no unrecognized tax benefits, and thus no related interest and penalties were recorded. Also, the Group does not expect that the amount of unrecognized tax benefits will significantly increase within the next twelve months.
</P>

<BR CLEAR="ALL" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS;">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
<A HREF="#A16-6109_120F_HTM_TABLEOFCONTENTS" TITLE="CLICK TO GO TO TABLE OF CONTENTS">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	ATA INC.
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Notes to the Consolidated Financial Statements (Continued)
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .25IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	According to the PRC Tax Administration and Collection Law, the statute of limitation is three years if the underpayment of taxes is due to computational errors made by the taxpayer or the withholding agent. The statute of limitation is extended to five years under special circumstances where the underpayment of taxes is more than RMB 100,000. In the case of transfer pricing issues, the statute of limitation is ten years. There is no statute of limitation in the case of tax evasion. The income tax return of each of the Company&#146;s PRC consolidated entities is subject to examination by the relevant tax authorities for the calendar tax years beginning in 20
</FONT>
	11.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	(1
</FONT>
</B>
<B>
	2
</B>
<B>
	)
</B>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<B>
	SHARE BASED COMPENSATION
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .25IN;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	2005 Share incentive plan
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .25IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	In April&nbsp;2005, the Company adopted a share incentive plan (the &#147;2005 Plan&#148;), pursuant to which the Company is authorized to issue options to officers, employees, directors and consultants of the Group to purchase up to 2,894,000 of its common shares. In October&nbsp;2007, the Company&#146;s board of directors approved an increase in the number of shares reserved for issuance under the 2005 Plan to 3,310,300 shares. The 2005 Plan expired in April&nbsp;201
</FONT>
	5. Options awards provide for accelerated vesting if there is a change in control (as defined in the 2005 Plan).
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .25IN;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	2008 Share incentive plan
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .25IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	On January&nbsp;7, 2008, the Company adopted a share incentive plan (the &#147;2008 Plan&#148;), pursuant to which the Company is authorized to issue options and other share-based awards to officers, employees, directors and consultants of the Group to purchase up to 336,307 of its common shares, plus, unless the board of directors determines a lesser amount, an annual increase on January&nbsp;1 of each calendar year beginning in 2009 equal to the lesser of 1) one percent of the number of shares issued and outstanding on December&nbsp;31 of the immediately preceding calendar year, and 2) 336,307 shares. The 2008 Plan expires in ten years. Options awards provide for accelerated vesting if there is a change in control (as defined in the 2008 Plan).
</FONT>
	As of March&nbsp;31, 2016, 3,026,763 shares were reserved for issuance under the 2008 Plan.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .25IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Under both the 2005 Plan and 2008 Plan, share options are generally granted with 25% vesting on the first anniversary of the grant date and the remaining 75% vesting ratably over the following 36&nbsp;months, unless a shorter or longer duration is established at the time of the option grant. Share options are granted at an exercise price equal to the fair market value of the Company&#146;s share at the date of grant and expire 10&nbsp;years from the grant date.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .25IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Under the 2008 Plan, nonvested shares are granted with a graded vesting as to 25% at the end of each year from the grant date over 4&nbsp;years.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .25IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	For the graded vesting share options and nonvested shares, the Company recognizes the compensation cost over the requisite service period for each separately vesting portion of the award as if the award is, in substance, multiple awards.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .25IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	During the year ended March&nbsp;31, 2013, the Company extended the exercise period of vested share options of two employees upon their resignation. In addition, the Company also continued the vesting of certain unvested share options and nonvested shares of these former employees. The modification resulted in additional compensation expense of RMB1,294,834 recognized in the &#147;general and administrative expense&#148; for the year ended March&nbsp;31, 2013.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .25IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	In October&nbsp;2013, 1,469,460 share options were granted to an officer, 25% of the options vest on the first anniversary of the grant date with the remaining 75% vesting evenly over the following three years. The exercise price of these options is USD2.50 per common share. In October&nbsp;2014, the remaining 75% share options were forfeited upon the officer&#146;s resignation. The expense of RMB
</FONT>
	4,014,513 related to the unvested share options
</FONT>
	recognized previously was reversed.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	F-
</FONT>
	31
<A NAME="A16-6109_120F_HTM_PB_31_210943_5893">

	In February&nbsp;2015, 1,469,460 share options were granted to an officer, 25% of the options vest on the first anniversary of the grant date with the remaining 75% vest evenly over the following three years. The exercise price of these options is USD2.24 per common share.

<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	In February&nbsp;2015, 100,000 and 114,314 common shares of the Company were granted to two officers respectively, using the Company&#146;s treasury shares. These common shares were immediately vested on grant date. The fair value of the common shares on the grant date of RMB
</FONT>
	2,831,396 was recognized
</FONT>
	as &#147;general and administrative expense&#148; for the year ended March&nbsp;31, 2015. The difference between the cost of the treasury shares repurchased of RMB 2,983,072 and the fair value of the common shares on grant date of RMB 151,676 was recognized as a reduction of additional paid-in capital.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .25IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	In April&nbsp;2015, the Company extended the exercise period of vested share options of certain employees for an additional six months. The modification resulted in additional compensation expense of RMB 1,635,726 for the year ended March&nbsp;31, 2016. All of these share options were expired without any exercise as of March&nbsp;31, 2016.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">

<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT 15.0PT;">

	A summary of the shares options activities for the years ended March&nbsp;31, 20
</FONT>
	14, 2015 and 2016 is presented below:

<TABLE BORDER="0" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE;">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="41%" VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="PADDING:0IN 0IN 0IN 0IN;WIDTH:41.0%;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="1" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="PADDING:0IN 0IN 0IN 0IN;WIDTH:2.5%;">

	The Company calculated the fair value of the share options on the grant date, and for
</FONT>
	the year- ended March&nbsp;31, 2016, the modification date, using the Black-Scholes-Merton pricing valuation model. The assumptions used in the valuation model are summarized as follows:

	The expected volatility was based on the historical volatilities of the Company. The expected term was related to the period of time the options are expected to be outstanding. The risk-free rate for periods within the contractual life of the option is based on the United States treasury yield curve in effect at the time of grant or modification.
</FONT>

	Compensation expense for share options

	of RMB 3,946,384, RMB 984,595 and RMB 8,040,512 was recognized for the years ended March&nbsp;31, 2014, 2015 and 2016.

	As of March&nbsp;31, 201
</FONT>
	6, RMB 5,934,262 of total unrecognized compensation expense related to nonvested share options is expected to be recognized over a weighted average period of approximately 2.90 years.

	The total fair value of shares vested during the years ended March&nbsp;31, 20
</FONT>
	14, 2015 and 2016, was USD 560,975, USD 821,250 and USD 831,375 respectively.
</P>

	&nbsp;
</FONT>

<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .25IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Upon the vesting of the nonvested shares, the Company withholds the shares issued to the employees to meet the relevant minimum tax withholding requirements. For the years ended March&nbsp;31, 2014, 2015 and 2016, the Company withheld 51,676, 54,000 and 51,234 vested shares upon the vesting of the nonvested shares to satisfactory the minimum tax withholding obligation
</FONT>
	.
</P>

<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">

<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<B>
	COMMON SHARES
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .25IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	The Company&#146;s board of directors approved a share repurchase program on November&nbsp;1, 20
</FONT>
	12 to repurchase up to USD5&nbsp;million worth of its issued and outstanding American Depository Shares (&#147;ADS&#148;) in both open-market and privately negotiated transactions. On January&nbsp;31, 2013, the Company&#146;s board of director reviewed and approved the continuation of the share repurchase program through May&nbsp;31, 2013. The Company&#146;s board of directors approved a share repurchase program on August&nbsp;5, 2014 to repurchase up to USD5&nbsp;million worth of its issued and outstanding ADSs in open-market through January&nbsp;31, 2015. The Company&#146;s board of directors approved a share repurchase program on September&nbsp;24, 2015 to repurchase up to USD3&nbsp;million worth of its issued and outstanding ADSs in open-market through March&nbsp;31, 2016. For the years ended March&nbsp;31, 2014, 2015 and 2016, the Company repurchased 10,678, 612,314 and 1,134,264 common shares at a repurchase price of RMB 132,528, RMB 8,362,136 and RMB 19,536,028, respectively.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .3IN;TEXT-INDENT:-.3IN;">

</FONT>

<B>
	SPECIAL
</B>
<B>
	CASH DIVIDENDS
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .25IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	On
</FONT>
	May&nbsp;30, 2014, the Company&#146;s board of directors declared a special cash dividend of USD0.205 per common share, or USD0.41 per ADS. The total amount of cash distributed in the dividend was USD9.5&nbsp;million (RMB 58,349,122) and was paid by cash in July&nbsp;2014.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>

</FONT>

	)

<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<B>
	STATUTORY RESERVES
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .25IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	In accordance with the relevant laws and regulations of the PRC, the Company&#146;s PRC consolidated entities are required to transfer 10% of their respective after tax profit, as determined in accordance with PRC accounting standards and regulations to a general reserve fund until the balance of the fund reaches 50% of the registered capital of the respective entity. The transfer to this general reserve fund must be made before distribution of dividends can be made. As of March&nbsp;31, 201
</FONT>
	5 and 2016, the PRC consolidated entities had appropriated RMB 26,389,274 and RMB 36,431,792, respectively, to the general reserve fund, which is restricted for distribution to the Company.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>

</FONT>

<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:18.2PT;">
<B>

<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .25IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	In May&nbsp;2015, the Group terminated the VIE
</FONT>
	agreements
</FONT>
	with the nominee shareholders. The entire equity interests of ATA Online were transferred from the nominee shareholders to ATA Learning and Zhongxiao Zhixing for a consideration of RMB 10,000,000, equaling to the amount of the registered capital of ATA Online. As a result, ATA Online became a wholly owned subsidiary of the Group. The consideration was paid to the nominee shareholders. As of March&nbsp;31, 2016, Mr.&nbsp;Haichang Xiong, has transferred his consideration of RMB 1,000,000 to Mr.&nbsp;Kevin Xiaofeng Ma, and the total amount of RMB 10,000,000 will be repaid to ATA BVI by Mr.&nbsp;Kevin Xiaofeng Ma based on the agreement between ATA BVI and the nominee shareholders.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:18.2PT;">
<B>

<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	(b)&nbsp;
</FONT>

</I>

<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	In March&nbsp;2016,
</FONT>
	ATA Learning lent RMB 1,000,000 to Satech, an equity method accounted investee, which was repaid in full in May&nbsp;2016.
</P>

	(c)&nbsp;

<B>
<I STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Sublease of Jianwai SOHO office to Master Mind (note 18)
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .25IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	ATA Testing subleased
</FONT>
	its Jianwai SOHO office to Master Mind, an equity method accounted investee, for a monthly rent of RMB 57,548, from May&nbsp;17, 2015 to May&nbsp;16, 2020. The Group recognized the sublease income of RMB 575,483 for the year ended March&nbsp;31, 2016.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .25IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	ATA Testing received
</FONT>
	a rent deposit of RMB 115,097 from Master Mind for the sublease and recorded the amount in accrued expenses and other payables as of March&nbsp;31, 2016.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:18.2PT;">
<B>
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	(d)&nbsp;
</FONT>
</I>
</B>
<B>
<I STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	USD300,000 convertible note (note 5)
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .25IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	On March&nbsp;30, 2016, ATA purchased
</FONT>
	a convertible promissory note of USD300,000 issued by Brilent.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>

<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .25IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	The Group entered into non-cancelable operating leases, primarily for office space, for initial terms of
</FONT>
	two to six years.

</FONT>

<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
<A HREF="#A16-6109_120F_HTM_TABLEOFCONTENTS" TITLE="CLICK TO GO TO TABLE OF CONTENTS">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	ATA INC.
</FONT>
</B>
<BR>
	Notes to the Consolidated Financial Statements (Continued)
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .25IN;TEXT-INDENT:2.55PT;">
<B>
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	(b)&nbsp;Purchase
</FONT>
</I>
</B>
<B>
<I STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	commitments
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT 23.1PT;TEXT-INDENT:.4PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	On August, 11, 2011, t
</FONT>
	he Group entered into an agreement with a vender granting the Group a license to distribute the vendor&#146;s test related products in Mainland China for 10 years. Each party may terminate this agreement at any time for any reason by giving the other party not less than twelve months written notice subject only that the earliest termination date may not be before the fifth anniversary of this agreement unless either party is in breach of this agreement. The future minimum payments under the non-cancelable purchase agreement as of March&nbsp;31, 2016 are:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>

<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:2.25PT;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">

<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<B>
	SUBSEQUENT EVENT
</B>
<B>
	S
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT 28.35PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	(a)&nbsp;ATA Learning has made an additional strategic investment of RMB8,466,660 in Satech,
</FONT>
	an equity method accounted investee. ATA Learning has entered into initial strategic investment in Satech in early 2015, after the additional strategic investment have been paid in April&nbsp;2016, ATA Learning owned 30.78% shareholder equity in Satech.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT 28.35PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	(b)&nbsp;
</FONT>
	On March&nbsp;24, 2016, ATA BVI entered into a convertible promissory notes (&#147;the Notes&#148;) purchase agreement with Brilent pursuant to which Brilent will issue up to USD2,500,000 of the Notes to certain investors including ATA BVI. In addition to the Notes of USD300,000 purchased on March&nbsp;30, 2016 (see note 5), ATA BVI purchased the Notes for an additional amount of USD1,200,000 issued by Brilent on April&nbsp;28, 2016.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT 28.35PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	(c)&nbsp;On May&nbsp;13, 2016, ATA Online entered into a strategic agreement with a China-based online education technology company, Medicine (Beijing) Education Technology Ltd. for medical, pharmacist and healthcare training and examination preparation. ATA Online will invest RMB 9.0 million and own 15% shareholdings in Medicine (Beijing) Education Technology Ltd., the initial payment of RMB 4.5 million was made in May&nbsp;2016.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT 28.35PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	(d)&nbsp;On April&nbsp;8, 2016, ATA Testing entered into an agreement to make a strategic investment in Empower Education Online, LLC (&#147;EEO&#148;), a China-based online education company that operates its self-developed leading web-based virtual classroom platform in China. This strategic investment of RMB32.5 million has been paid in
</FONT>
	June
</FONT>
	2016 and, ATA Testing owns 8.33% shareholdings in Empower Education Online, LLC (&#147;EEO&#148;).
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT 28.35PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	(e)&nbsp;On June&nbsp;16, 2016, ATA Testing entered into an agreement to make a strategic investment in ApplySquare Education&nbsp;&amp; Technology Co.,&nbsp;Ltd. (&#147;ApplySquare&#148;), a China-based online education technology company focused on providing academic solutions and resources to the global higher education community. ATA Testing will invest USD3.0 million (RMB19.7 million) and own 9% shareholdings in ApplySquare Education&nbsp;&amp; Technology Co.,&nbsp;Ltd. (&#147;ApplySquare&#148;).
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>

<EFX_EXHIBIT_12>
<A NAME="FIS_EXHIBIT_12"></A>
<DIV>
<P ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:RIGHT;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Exhibit&nbsp;12.1
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Certification by the Chief Executive Officer
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Pursuant to Section&nbsp;302 of the Sarbanes-Oxley Act of 2002
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	I, Kevin Xiaofeng Ma, certify that:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	1. I have reviewed this annual report on Form&nbsp;20-F of ATA Inc. (the &#147;Company&#148;);
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	2. Based on my knowledge, this report does not contain any untrue statement of a material fact or omit to state a material fact necessary to make the statements made, in light of the circumstances under which such statements were made, not misleading with respect to the period covered by this report;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	3. Based on my knowledge, the financial statements, and other financial information included in this report, fairly present in all material respects the financial condition, results of operations and cash flows of the Company as of, and for, the periods presented in this report;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	4. The Company&#146;s other certifying officer and I are responsible for establishing and maintaining disclosure controls and procedures (as defined in Exchange Act Rules&nbsp;13a-15(e)&nbsp;and 15d-15(e)) and internal control over financial reporting (as defined in Exchange Act Rules&nbsp;13a-15(f)&nbsp;and 15d-15(f)) for the Company and have:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT 31.9PT;TEXT-INDENT:-30.8PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	(a)&nbsp;Designed such disclosure controls and procedures, or caused such disclosure controls and procedures to be designed under our supervision, to ensure that material information relating to the company, including its consolidated subsidiaries, is made known to us by others within those entities, particularly during the period in which this report is being prepared;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT 31.9PT;TEXT-INDENT:-27.5PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	(b)&nbsp;Designed such internal control over financial reporting, or caused such internal control over financial reporting to be designed under our supervision, to provide reasonable assurance regarding the reliability of financial reporting and the preparation of financial statements for external purposes in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT 31.9PT;TEXT-INDENT:-27.5PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	(c)&nbsp;Evaluated the effectiveness of the Company&#146;s disclosure controls and procedures and presented in this report our conclusions about the effectiveness of the disclosure controls and procedures, as of the end of the period covered by this report based on such evaluation; and
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT 31.9PT;TEXT-INDENT:-27.5PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	(d)&nbsp;Disclosed in this report any change in the Company&#146;s internal control over financial reporting that occurred during the period covered by the annual report that has materially affected, or is reasonably likely to materially affect, the Company&#146;s internal control over financial reporting; and
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	5. The Company&#146;s other certifying officer and I have disclosed, based on our most recent evaluation of internal control over financial reporting, to the Company&#146;s auditors and the audit committee of the Company&#146;s board of directors (or persons performing the equivalent functions):
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT 31.9PT;TEXT-INDENT:-30.8PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	(a)&nbsp;All significant deficiencies and material weaknesses in the design or operation of internal control over financial reporting which are reasonably likely to adversely affect the Company&#146;s ability to record, process, summarize and report financial information; and
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT 31.9PT;TEXT-INDENT:-30.8PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	(b)&nbsp;Any fraud, whether or not material, that involves management or other employees who have a significant role in the Company&#146;s internal control over financial reporting.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Date: June&nbsp;24, 2016

</P>

<DIV>
<P ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:RIGHT;TEXT-INDENT:240.0PT;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Exhibit&nbsp;12.2
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Certification by the Chief Financial Officer
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Pursuant to Section&nbsp;302 of the Sarbanes-Oxley Act of 2002
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	I, Shelly Jiang, certify that:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	1. I have reviewed this annual report on Form&nbsp;20-F of ATA Inc. (the &#147;Company&#148;);
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	2. Based on my knowledge, this report does not contain any untrue statement of a material fact or omit to state a material fact necessary to make the statements made, in light of the circumstances under which such statements were made, not misleading with respect to the period covered by this report;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	3. Based on my knowledge, the financial statements, and other financial information included in this report, fairly present in all material respects the financial condition, results of operations and cash flows of the Company as of, and for, the periods presented in this report;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	4. The Company&#146;s other certifying officer and I are responsible for establishing and maintaining disclosure controls and procedures (as defined in Exchange Act Rules&nbsp;13a-15(e)&nbsp;and 15d-15(e)) and internal control over financial reporting (as defined in Exchange Act Rules&nbsp;13a-15(f)&nbsp;and 15d-15(f)) for the Company and have:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT 31.9PT;TEXT-INDENT:-27.5PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	(a)&nbsp;Designed such disclosure controls and procedures, or caused such disclosure controls and procedures to be designed under our supervision, to ensure that material information relating to the company, including its consolidated subsidiaries, is made known to us by others within those entities, particularly during the period in which this report is being prepared;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT 31.9PT;TEXT-INDENT:-30.8PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	(b)&nbsp;Designed such internal control over financial reporting, or caused such internal control over financial reporting to be designed under our supervision, to provide reasonable assurance regarding the reliability of financial reporting and the preparation of financial statements for external purposes in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT 31.9PT;TEXT-INDENT:-30.8PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	(c)&nbsp;Evaluated the effectiveness of the Company&#146;s disclosure controls and procedures and presented in this report our conclusions about the effectiveness of the disclosure controls and procedures, as of the end of the period covered by this report based on such evaluation; and
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT 31.9PT;TEXT-INDENT:-30.8PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	(d)&nbsp;Disclosed in this report any change in the Company&#146;s internal control over financial reporting that occurred during the period covered by the annual report that has materially affected, or is reasonably likely to materially affect, the Company&#146;s internal control over financial reporting; and
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	5. The Company&#146;s other certifying officer and I have disclosed, based on our most recent evaluation of internal control over financial reporting, to the Company&#146;s auditors and the audit committee of the Company&#146;s board of directors (or persons performing the equivalent functions):
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	(a)&nbsp;All significant deficiencies and material weaknesses in the design or operation of internal control over financial reporting which are reasonably likely to adversely affect the Company&#146;s ability to record, process, summarize and report financial information; and
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	(b)&nbsp;Any fraud, whether or not material, that involves management or other employees who have a significant role in the Company&#146;s internal control over financial reporting.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Date: June&nbsp;24, 2016
</FONT>
</P>
